intro: Impatiens muliensis, commonly known as the Muliensis Impatiens, is a flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the family Balsaminaceae and is characterized by its vibrant, showy flowers that typically come in shades of red, pink, and white. The plant features heart-shaped leaves and produces delicate, spurred petals that attract pollinators. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens, though it is more commonly encountered in its natural habitat.
